title: Audio Visual Systems Engineer
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Audio Visual Systems Engineer Howard Community College in Columbia, MD Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: Multimedia About Us Howard Community College (HCC) is an exciting place to work, learn, and grow! We are proud to have received the Great Colleges to Work For honor for 12 consecutive years, 2009-2020. Howard Community College values diversity among its faculty, staff and student population. We are an innovative institution that is committed to responding to the ever-changing needs and interests of a diverse and dynamic community. No matter where you want to go in your career, you can get there from here! Minimum Compensation: $70,358 General Responsibilities The Audio Visual Systems Engineer is responsible for the engineering, design, and development for all HCC AV systems on main campus and satellite locations. The AV Systems Engineer works with critical stakeholders, project managers, consultants, control system programmers, procurement, and vendors to create integrated presentation, entertainment, and media production systems; producing professional documentation and maintaining internal and industry consistency across evolving enterprise systems. This role is responsible for creating, reviewing, modifying, and archiving multiple formats of CAD files; including furniture integrations, system flow diagrams, riser elevations, and reflected ceiling plan/low-voltage wiring schematics. This position works in construction and project environments, evaluating AV Submittals, RFI's, and conducting phased commissioning of system installations; requiring understanding of the surrounding trades and fire/building codes and standards. The AV Engineer is responsible for developing projected budget requirements for integration initiatives, developing RFP and contract documentation, and working with product and trade engineers to modify existing technologies to suit the needs of the college. This role oversees wireless presentation systems, streaming audio-video distribution, and digital media infrastructure; working with HCC Network and Facilities to meet all college, legal, and safety compliance requirements. This position is responsible for maintaining current industry training and product fluency; as well as emerging AV technology research. Work Performed Audio Visual Systems Engineering and Design Works with Project Managers and End-Users to develop scope and design requirements Creates and updates integrated enterprise presentation systems; accounting for project scope, college standards, industry standards, and legal requirements Produces professional system engineering profiles; with all trade, vendor, and contract applicable standards Commissions and evaluates phased installations; enforcing contract standards, generating punch list revisions, and evaluating remediations. Enterprise System Standardization and Compliance Establishes equipment, product, and integration standards for presentational equipment and infrastructure Maintains current product, industry, trade, and legal fluency; updating systems and standards cyclically Makes data driven determinations of equipment life expectancies, maintenance requirements, and refurbishment cycles Drafting, Documentation, and Budget Generation Produces professional digital design documents using CAD software including; signal flow contract documentation, rack and wall plate elevations, electrical and floor plan diagrams, furniture integration diagrams, mounting risers/elevations, reflected ceiling plans, and low voltage wiring schematics. Generates or evaluates the opinion of probable cost (OPC) for AV project integration using industry standards, and trade experience. Generates or evaluates integration contract standards for equipment, infrastructure, and installation for all major AV initiatives. Creates and maintains documentation and engineering archives; including as-builts, submittals, RFI's, and elevations Advanced System Repair and Modification Troubleshoots and repairs tier 3 AV system failures; working with product engineers and documenting remediations Works with Information Technology and Facilities Engineers to solve interdisciplinary and interrelated systems failure Maintains current and emerging industry and technology fluency; making recommendations and identifying important trends in system design Maintains relationships with product engineers and engineering affinity groups, representing the college technology and engineering needs/challenges Works with Associate Director to generate cyclical maintenance requirements Other duties as assigned Minimum Education Required: Bachelor's degree Minimum Number of Years Experience Required: 3 Other Knowledge Required Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent, in related technical field (Prefer Master's) 3+ years of related experience AVIXA - CTS-D certification Crestron DMC-Engineering-4K certification Crestron CTI-P201 Core System Programming, preferred AutoCAD certified professional, preferred CAPM or PMP certification, preferred OSHA hazardous chemical certification OSHA electrical certification Certified Electrical Safety Compliance Professional Knowledge and experience with line-level voltage work Knowledge and experience with low-voltage work OTHER REQUIREMENTS Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work independently and as a team member Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask. Ability to maintain strict confidentiality Experience with cable termination and management Experience with Bi-Amp or equivalent DSP Experience in Higher Education Knowledge of OSHA safety standards Experience with vendor communications Prefer experience with contract evaluation/negotiation Valid MD Driver's License Ability to read and generate professional AV system schematic diagrams Manual and finger dexterity; arm-hand steadiness Visual color discrimination (ability to match or detect difference between colors, including shades of color and brightness) Near vision (ability to see details at close range) Hearing acuity (ability to detect and differentiate high and low frequencies at low Dbs.) Regular attendance is a requirement of this job. Performs all duties while considering the impact of any actions on the college's sustainability initiatives in the areas of environmental stewardship, social responsibility, and economic prosperity. Supervisory Postion? Yes Posting Number: B220P Applicant Instructions Pre-employment criminal background investigation is a condition of employment. HCC is interested in all qualified applicants who are eligible to work in the United States. However, HCC will generally not sponsor applicants for work visas. Due to HCC policy, only employees living in states contiguous to Maryland are eligible for work at HCC and include Virginia, West Virginia, Washington DC, Pennsylvania. Candidates must live in the commutable area or willing to relocate at their own expense if offered the position because HCC does not offer relocation benefits. Please complete the entire HCC Employment Application (Candidates will be evaluated on completing the college's application in full). EEO Statement Howard Community College (HCC) is an Equal Employment Opportunity & Affirmative Action employer & values diversity within its faculty, staff & student population. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. HCC understands that persons with specific disabilities may need assistance with the job application process and/or with the interview process. For confidential assistance with the job application process, please contact the Office of Human Resources at 443-518-1100. Howard Community College is an Equal Opportunity & Affirmative Action employer & values diversity within its faculty, staff & student population. title: Instruction & Classroom Support Tech 1
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Instruction & Classroom Support Tech 1 Wenatchee Valley College in Wenatchee, WA Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Application Due: 08/31/2023 Category: Multimedia Instruction & Classroom Support Tech 1 Wenatchee Valley College Salary: See Position Description Job Type: Part-time Job Number: 2023-00024 Location: Wenatchee, WA Department: Allied Health Closing: 8/31/2023 4:00 PM Pacific Job Summary This position collaborates with the simulation lab and allied health department members in performing duties essential to the achievement of the departmental goals for simulation. The main purpose of this position is to function as a support person to the simulation lab coordinator, allied health faculty and students in the simulation lab on the Wenatchee campus. The position reports to the dean of allied health & professional technical programs. Essential Functions 1. Works to support the daily functions of the simulation laboratory by: a) Collaborative advising and consulting with the simulation lab coordinator. b) Monitors procedures for signing out of simulation lab equipment and supplies; assists with the movement of simulation equipment from one lab area to another. c) Assist with scenarios used for simulation experiences using role playing, props and dialogue to create a realistic learning environment. 2. Maintains the simulation inventory system by: a) Assisting with annual inventory of the simulation laboratory. b) Assisting with ordering supplies as needed for the simulation laboratory inventory and other allied health programs as needed. c) Ensuring the safe storage of hazardous materials. d) Overseeing the collection and disposal of waste materials according to approved state regulations. e) Assists with maintaining a current inventory that tracks consumable supply costs, vendor information, and usage history as a basis for recommendation for ordering supplies and determining student needs. f) Maintains the schedule for use of the lab and equipment. 3. Participates in and contributes to the upkeep of simulation laboratory by: a) Providing advice and orientation to instructors regarding simulation laboratory procedures, location and use of materials and the operation of equipment. b) Recommending and/or performing general cleaning in the simulation laboratory. c) Recommending and/or performing maintenance or repairs of equipment in the simulation laboratory. 4. Participates in and contributes to a safe environment in the simulation laboratory by: a) Keeping current with safety regulations. b) Establishing, updating and maintaining safety policy within the simulation lab. c) Checking and maintaining all equipment used in the simulation lab. d) Provide training and enforcement of safety procedures to individuals, including faculty, students and staff using the simulation laboratory. 5. Participates in and contributes to the learning needs of students in allied health programs by: a) Supports simulation lab in working with allied health students practicing skills in the sim lab. b) Independently, or in conjunction with other faculty/college personnel, assisting students in realizing course objectives through use of the simulations and simulation software as appropriate. c) Demonstrating ability to relate to students, staff, and faculty of varied ethnicity, ages, backgrounds, and abilities and a commitment to a culturally diverse environment. d) Conducting tours and simulation sessions for internal/external groups and/or individuals. This is not intended to be an exclusive list of all duties and responsibilities. Related duties and responsibilities may be assigned. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent. Six months full-time experience/training in a lab setting. Excellent organizational skills. Ability to set priorities and work independently. Demonstrate excellent customer service, interpersonal communication, and problem solving, combined with a collaborative work style. Preferred Qualifications: Computer skills/electronic medical record experience. Ability to work with some flexibility in schedule. Current CNA/MA certification in the state of Washington or interest in working in a health care training environment. First Aid/CPR certification. Experience creating digital content (such as Word/PDF documents and web and learning management system content as appropriate to the role) in accessible formats. Bilingual to Spanish and English. Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Demonstrated ability to use exceptional communication and interpersonal skills demonstrating professionalism, empathy, diplomacy, discretion and integrity in interactions with diverse constituencies. Knowledge of testing procedures and protocol, testing security and confidentiality. Experience with PeopleSoft software preferred. Quality: Accurate and thorough, prepare detailed reports, evaluate processes to identify ways to improve and promote quality. Professionalism: Approach others in a tactful manner, react well under pressure, treat others with respect and consideration and follow through on commitments. Ability to assess situations, exercise independent judgement, resolve issues and coordinate with IT support services when technical issues arise. Diversity, equity and inclusion: Demonstrated competency and experience working in a diverse academic environment, inclusive of students, faculty, and staff of varying social, economic, cultural, ideological, gender and racial/ethnic backgrounds and those with physical, emotional and/or learning disabilities. Additional Information Terms of Employment: The current vacancy in allied health is a half-time, overtime and benefit eligible position expected to begin as soon as possible. The half-time starting salary is $22,202* annually, $1,850/month, $21.27 per hour with periodic increases and earning potential to $25,690*/annually, $2,141*/month, $23.60*/hour . The list established by this recruitment will be used to fill this position only. *Salaries include a 4% wage increase effective July 1, 2023. Your paycheck is just part of the total compensation package. There is an outstanding benefits package which is worth an additional value equivalent to about 30% of your salary. A comprehensive health care benefits package for you and your dependents includes medical, dental and vision insurance; life and long- term disability insurance plans; vacation, sick and personal leave; reduced tuition; and retirement benefits are also provided. For more information, please visit our Benefits website at: https://www.wvc.edu/humanr esources/benefits.html , Work Schedule & Environment: Work hours are generally between 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday; hours and days may change depending on the needs of the college. Work in a busy office environment with frequent interruptions and distractions. Conditions of Employment: Wenatchee Valley College only employs U.S. citizens and lawfully authorized non-U.S. citizens. All new employees must show proof of identity, and eligibility verification as required by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. All offers of employment are subject to background checks. Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position. Finalists are required to complete the sexual misconduct disclosure form as required under RCW 288.112.080. A valid Washington state driver's license may be required. Bargaining Unit: This position has been designated as a bargaining unit position represented by the Washington Public Employees Association. Application and Selection Procedure: Complete application packages must include the following: Complete Wenatchee Valley College online application. Upload cover letter that specifically describes how your educational background and experience meet the minimum and preferred qualifications. Upload resume. Complete supplemental questions. It is your responsibility to submit all required application materials before the deadline. Please do not send reference letters or other unsolicited materials. They will not be shared with the screening committee and cannot be returned to you. Only finalists may be asked to send additional materials. Attachments from prior applications will not upload automatically to your new application. Should you have difficulties uploading your documents, please contact NeoGov Technical Support at 1-855-524-5627 for assistance. The position closes at 4 p.m., August 31, 2023 . The college reserves the right to reopen or extend the closing date. A limited number of applicants who meet the needs of the position and the college will be interviewed. Reasonable Accommodation: Applicants with disabilities who require assistance with the application and employment process will be accommodated to the extent reasonably possible. Requests should be made to the human resources office by calling 509-682-6440. Persons who are deaf or hard of hearing may dial 711 to place a call through Washington Relay, the state's free telecommunication access service. Equal Opportunity Employer: Wenatchee Valley College is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in employment and student enrollment. All programs are free from discrimination and harassment against any person because of race, creed, color, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, or the use of a service animal by a person with a disability, age, parental status or families with children, marital status, religion, genetic information, honorably discharged veteran or military status or any other prohibited basis per RCW 49.60.030, 040 and other federal and laws and regulations, or participation in the complaint process. The following persons have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies and Title IX compliance for both the Wenatchee and Omak campuses: To report discrimination or harassment: Title IX Coordinator, Wenatchi Hall 2322M, (509) 682-6445, Dial 711, title9@wvc.edu . To request disability accommodations: Student Access Director, Wenatchi Hall 2133, (509) 682-6854, TTY/TTD: Dial 711, sas@wvc.edu . This recruitment announcement may not reflect the entire job description and can be changed and or modified at any time. The TSP team is the primary ITS liaison, technology service representative and technical advisor for many in the University of Idaho community. The TSP team directly interacts and supports customers with their information technology needs and resolving issues. The Technology Solutions Partner (TSP) Manager is responsible for developing, implementing and cultivating statewide enterprise support solutions for University faculty, staff and students. The TSP manager will manage, coach and motivate a team of TSP's, perform process engineering and communicating to a variety of audiences through numerous media channels. As part of the TSP leadership team, they will report to the Director of Technology Partnerships Duties may include: Lead, manage and develop a team of TSPs Develop and maintain standards Oversee the delivery of solutions Conduct surveys and monitor TSP customer feedback Develop partnerships within the U of I community Manage budgets Work as an active member of the division leadership team Perform daily TSP duties, taking on high-priority incidents or requests Other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications: High School Diploma or equivalent 7 years in an information technology role, specifically providing direct customer technical support Coaching others in providing customer service Working in a team environment to accomplish shared goals Preferred Qualifications: Preferred Education: Bachelors Degree in an information technology field MTA: Windows Operating System Fundamentals certification or equivalent Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate certification or equivalent Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification Preferred Experience: Demonstrated experience with assignment coordination and staff management, service delivery processes, intra/inter-team communications, budgeting, and measures/metrics Working within a complex network infrastructure and VoIP equipment, operation and application Managing endpoints utilizing tools such as SCCM, Active Directory, Azure tools and Jamf in a complex, large enterprise Working in higher education Preferred Skills and Abilities: Strong customer service orientation with the commitment and drive to provide first class customer service and support Excellent organization and attention to detail Excellent verbal and written communications and the ability to communicate with a variety of audiences Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills Physical Requirements & Working Conditions: Frequently lifts, carries and/or otherwise moves information technology equipment weighing up to 50 pounds indoors and outdoors. Ability to: Traverse between buildings, floors within buildings Climb ladders Crawl or maneuver in tight places. Frequently lifts, carries and/or otherwise moves information technology equipment weighing up to 50 pounds indoors and outdoors.Ability to:Traverse between buildings, floors within buildingsClimb laddersCrawl or maneuver in tight places. Required Licensures, Certifications or other Posting Number: SP004014P Posting Date: 07/10/2023 Closing Date: Open Until Filled: Yes Special Instructions: Position will remain open until a qualified pool of applicants has been identified. title: Chief Information Officer
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Chief Information Officer Palm Beach State College in Lake Worth, FL Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Application Due: Open Until Filled Category: IT Manager/Director ; +1 Network/System Administrator Job Description Reporting to the President as a member of senior management, the Chief Information Officer is responsible for the strategic leadership and vision to guide the future direction of Information Technology in support of the mission of the College. Through leadership and collaborative partnerships, the CIO will drive information technology within the academic and administrative organizations at a strategic level where information and technology are optimally deployed to support business process re-engineering, teaching and learning, and managerial success in a distributed organizational environment. This role is responsible for ERP systems, academic computing, application and data support services, quality and customer support, infrastructure support, client support, and cyber security services. First initial review: August 1, 2023. Duties and Responsibilities: (This list is not exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary) Formulates, develops, and implements policies and procedures. Develops short-term and long-range goals, objectives, priorities, and recommendations. Leads strategic and operational planning to achieve business goals by fostering innovation, prioritizing initiatives, and coordinating the evaluation, deployment, and management of current and future IT systems across the organization. Identifies opportunities for the appropriate and cost-effective investment of financial resources in IT systems and resources. Develops business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for IT spending and initiatives. Collaborates with administrators on formulating technology goals. Evaluates computing systems and College requirements. Recommends system development plans to accommodate expected needs. Oversees all phases of systems design, programming, computer installation and operations. Identifies the strategic objectives and determines the specific information requirements for management information services. Directs development and execution of an enterprise-wide disaster recovery and business continuity plan. Achieves desired results through the efficient use of budgets, proper contracts and effective decision making. Monitors expenditures in assigned budget and holds self and staff accountable for financial practices that promote sound fiscal management. Develops and implements an academic computing technology plan to encompass support of the college's academic programs. Manages and provides guidance, direction, and observation of staff whom you directly supervise. This includes but is not limited to conducting performance appraisals, goal setting, career and performance counseling, identification and evaluation of training and development needs for staff. Maintains current knowledge of field or profession. Travels to training workshops, conferences, meetings, and professional events outside of college locations, as needed. Performs other job-related duties as assigned. Required Minimum Qualifications : Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree Eight years of related experience, and experience in supervision Experience with a variety of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems Knowledge of: Programming, systems, and database administration Microsoft Office Professional or similar application Skilled in: Mentoring team members to develop goal setting plans, share knowledge and experiences Resolving conflicts between individual needs and requirements of the organization Strategic thinking including effective planning, setting goals, monitoring progress, tracking results, and making appropriate adjustments to plans based on circumstances and context Project management design and analysis Attention to detail while maintaining effective time and task management Ability to: Accurately manage a budget Make lively and effective presentations Collect, organize, analyze, and present information in a meaningful manner Install and troubleshoot PC hardware and software Handle highly sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality Licenses, Registration, Certifications, or Special Requirements: Regular physical attendance required Preferred Qualifications : Education and Experience: Master's degree Experience in higher education Licenses, Registration, Certifications, or Special Requirements: Project Management certification Work Environment and Physical Demand: Reach and grasp objects Stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl Use of video display terminal Use of manual dexterity and fine motor skills Communicate information orally and in writing Receive and understand information through oral and written communication Proofread and check documents for accuracy Work a fluctuating work schedule This job description is intended to be generic in nature and describe the essential functions of the job. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. The essential duties, functions and responsibilities, and overtime eligibility may vary based on the specific tasks assigned to the position. Employment Information Please review the following information in order to apply for a position at Palm Beach State College: Carefully review the minimum qualifications advertised for the available position as only applicants meeting the minimum requirements will be considered. Background Check/ Drug Screen may be required based on the specific requirements of the position for which the application is being submitted. Employment is contingent upon the passing of a drug test and upon completion of a criminal background investigation. title: Executive Director
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Executive Director ellucian in Purchase, NY Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: IT Manager/Director Together we are powering the future of Higher Education Here at Ellucian, we are motivated by a mission ~ the power of education to transform lives and change the world. We are the global market leader in EdTech for Higher Education, serving more than 2,900 customers and reaching over 22 million students in 50+ countries. We are dedicated to helping Higher Ed thrive by transforming their institutions to agile, digitally connected campuses that enable student success. About the Opportunity Ellucian is looking for an ambitious and energetic leader to manage Information Technology activities at Manhattanville College. As the Executive Director, you will work onsite at Manhattanville College. You will report to the Ellucian General Manager and College CIO/VP-IT, and be responsible to other site leadership managing the day-to-day operations of the Ellucian-staffed IT department. Your priority is to ensure client satisfaction through service delivery, relationship building, resource management, and contract compliance. As the Executive Director you will work directly with the College's CIO and IT leadership team to align projects and operations with Manhattanville's institutional mission, vision and values. This role will maintain an exceptionally high level of responsiveness by proactively communicating with appropriate client stakeholders, Ellucian management, and the IT organization. Where you will make an impact Managing the day-to-day operations of the information technology department including directing staff, who support administrative and enterprise systems, networking systems, user services and help desk, web services, and other information technology functions. Participating and interacting with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors as appropriate to secure value-added products and services. Developing and implementing policies for effective practices and operational standards. Create and maintain appropriate documentation relevant to IT support services. Research industry best practices, benchmarks and tools and identify opportunities to incorporate into IT and College best practices. Manage, mentor, and provide overall guidance for all Ellucian site-based team members. Providing support and management for the administration of the Ellucian Colleague ERP and the daily support of the College's ongoing evolution of its implementation and integration with connected systems Providing support and management of the administrative systems and iT staff including meeting regularly to review progress of work, resolution of problems, and ensure that standards for quality and quantity of work are met. Consulting with management and reviewing project proposals to determine goals, time frame, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing administrative computing projects, staffing requirements, and allotment of resources. Effectively managing projects and resources using project management methodologies to articulate project demands, recommend priorities to user support groups and committees, and provide frequent project updates while adhering to established timelines. Developing and implementing IT, ERP, and associated administrative systems change management, communication planning, testing procedures, and programming documentation. Providing support and management for functional and technical support for administrative applications including system configuration and usage guidance to the administrative user community. Providing and managing systems analysis, problem solving support, and necessary programming support to provide efficient and effective use of administrative information systems in support of customer goals and objectives. Implementing quality assurance methodologies for change management and problem management. Meeting with users and staff to determine the impact of proposed changes in hardware or software for users. Supporting College departmental staff and administration with the identification, evaluation, selection, support and maintenance of third-party software and hardware systems solutions. Ability to lead multiple small to moderately sized projects in the Higher Education market. Preparing a monthly online dashboard report to the client and Ellucian management which includes project status, risks, and performance against key performance indicators. What you will bring Experience in Higher Education Information Technology Support Plus 5-7 years of experience showing advancement, which includes project management and/or leadership within IT Service Management and general industry experience. Strong customer service / client relationship management experience required. Deep knowledge of the Ellucian Colleague ERP, functional and technical expertise. Varied and strong higher ed business/technical background and project management experience. Must demonstrate strong listening and information gathering skills to ensure an accurate understanding is accomplished and communicated. Must be able to work within high-performance teams and interact with all levels of the project team to persuade and build consensus. Must have the flexibility to work a regular schedule with additional evening and early morning hours as required. Excellent time-management, planning and interpersonal skills. Effectively manage scope and customer expectations on individual assignments. Must have the ability to work effectively with end-users, gain their confidence, understand their technical and operational needs, and translate them into viable technical solutions. Superior verbal and written skills, encompassing complete understanding on the English language with exceptional communication skills. Strong organizational, project management, and leadership skills, and ability to work with staff, faculty, and administration at all skill and management levels. Willingness to work as a contributing member of the team including other systems personnel, the operations staff, and the account administrators. Ability to read and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. What makes #Ellucianlife Comprehensive health coverage: medical, dental, and vision Flexible time off Thrive Flex Program that allows you to contribute towards your health, financial or learning interests 401k w/ match & Bright Plan - to help you save for the future Maternity & Paternity Leave Charitable leave - 40 hours/year Telemedicine Wellness Ginger (mental health) Wellbeats (virtual fitness classes) Rethink - caregiver support Diversity and inclusion programs which provide access to 11 internal employee resource groups Tuition Reimbursement Assistance Professional development opportunities #LI-JW1 #LI-onsite Apply on Institution's Website Related Searches: IT Manager/Director Want to learn more about working for this employer? title: Learning Technology Administrator
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Learning Technology Administrator ellucian in Huntsville, AL Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: Instructional Technology and Design ; +2 Multimedia ; Distance Education Programs Learning Technology Administrator (Oakwood University) The Learning Technology Administrator will be an integral member of the IT team, collaborating with diverse and talented team members to help solve multidimensional information and instructional technology problems, improve the content delivery experience, and generate value for our campus stakeholders across a broad base of departments and constituencies. The successful candidate will be primarily charged with focusing on supporting day-to-day activities with the university’s learning management system. In addition, the Learning Technology Administrator will perform tests and pilots of viable technologies and assist with crafting documentation to move from the plan/build to run and complete the integration in production once approved. Where you will make an impact Provide university-wide system support for the institution’s LMS. Provide technical online course support for faculty and students using the LMS. Collaborate with university instructional designers and the User Services team. Provide LMS training to faculty, students, and staff as required. Document processes, procedures, KPI's, and generating reports demonstrating effective use of the LMS platform Collaborate with all members of the IT team to find technical solutions for learner and instructor problems Continually seek to improve the quality of the learning experience for the institution’s students. Adaptable to flexible work schedules while maintaining good communication with the team. Work closely with campus IT leadership on upgrade issues and other LMS processes. What will you bring Experience in Educational Technology, Instructional design, or equivalent experience preferred. Minimum of three to five (3-5) years of experience in Educational or Informational Technology or Online Learning. Experience administrating and teaching with the LMS (BrightSpace/Colleague preferred). Ability to develop and deliver effective training programs for a broad range of IT and business professionals, along with instructional design experience and knowledge of adult learning principles. Proficiency in LMS and other learning technologies. Ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels. Ability to inspire and influence team members and others to implement positive changes. Committed to customer satisfaction: exceptional skills in collaboration, consultation, communication, customer support, data analysis, and time management. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite. Ellucian is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. Ellucian promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons and veterans. title: Director of Information Technology (IT)
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Director of Information Technology (IT) Woodbury University in Burbank, CA Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Application Due: Open Until Filled Category: IT Manager/Director Woodbury University invites applications for the position of Director of Information Technology (IT). Reporting to the Vice President of Finance & Accounting, the Director of IT is responsible for leadership, visions, and direction of the University’s enterprise information assets to ensure their integrity, efficiency, relevance, and accessibility. This position oversees all academic and administrative technology serving the Burbank and San Diego campuses and has a strong customer service orientation while being responsible for ensuring that information technology services meet the curricular and administrative requirements of the University. These are determined from institutional goals and the strategic plan guiding the University through capacity building in support of ambitious expansion and growth. This position qualifies for university sponsored employee benefit plans and programs (e.g., group health insurance, life insurance, tax deferred annuity plan, annual vacation, sick, and paid holidays), subject to the eligibility requirements and conditions of each plan and program. Salary/Hourly Range: $140,429.00 - $150,461.00 (commensurate with experience and qualifications). Responsibilities Lead IT strategic and operational implementations to achieve institutional goals both short- and long-term by fostering innovation, prioritizing IT initiatives, and coordinating the evaluation, deployment, and management of current and future IT systems. Provides technological vision, long-range planning, and directing for all functions of the University in support of the University’s strategic plan and both institutional and organizational goals. Consults with and provides solutions for university divisions, schools, and departments in the use of technology to improve both processes and services. Ensures Information Technology (IT) resources and data are secured against unauthorized access and are thoroughly protected against loss. Maintains an IT Disaster Recovery Plan and the IT related components of the University’s Business Continuity Plan. Directs staff and overall operations of the IT department ensuring that its services meet and exceed the expectations of faculty, staff, students and campus visitors. Manages the selection, purchase, installation, integration, maintenance, and ongoing support of the full spectrum of the University’s technology systems and resources including: Enterprise and department-wide applications and associated computer hardware; networking infrastructure including all WANs, LANs (both wired and wireless), and telephone systems; computer workstations including both PCs and Macs; academic computer lab hardware and software; and classroom based computer technology (workstations, projectors…) Prepares and manages IT budgets and evaluates the cost of current and future IT systems. Identifies, develops, implements, and maintains all IT related policies. Builds and manages IT vendor relationships for the benefit of the University. Consults with and negotiates purchase terms and contracts with software, hardware, and telecommunications vendors. Supports the University efforts in fund-raising and procuring donations to offset overall technology costs. Additional duties as required. Qualifications and Education Requirements A minimum of five years highly successful experience as a Lead of IT or Director of IT for an institution of similar size or larger (2,000 + computer users) with eight to ten years working in the IT field. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or technology related field required; Master’s degree is preferred. Planning for and managing technological change. Experience in preparing and implementing IT strategic plan(s). Establishing and managing diverse application delivery approaches from traditional in-house hosting to cloud hosting to mobile apps. Managing both business systems and technical applications is a plus. Proven leadership and personnel management skills and the ability to effectively work with a diverse population of IT customers each having unique needs. Demonstrates proven competencies in transforming, building, and growing a strong IT and delivery service organization that achieves efficient operations and provides the highest business value through effective management. Detail oriented with strong project planning, execution, and management expertise. Hands on when necessary. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Physical Requirements To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Good vision, hearing/listening, and clear speech. Hand/fingers dexterity. Simple to complex reading, writing, clerical, and math skills. A combination of sedentary work, walking, standing, lifting and/or carrying up to 25 pounds. Works with and has verbal contact with others. Application: Review of applications will begin Immediately and remain open until filled. All application materials must be submitted through the Woodbury University Job Board . Email applications and submissions on third party platforms will not be considered. Submissions must include: Current resume Cover Letter Contact information for at least three references About Woodbury University Located in Southern California at the global epicenter of creativity and influence, Woodbury University earns its reputation as a leading creative university thanks to nationally ranked programs in its School of Architecture and School of Media, Culture & Design. What makes the university unique is the array of unparalleled academic offerings in its School of Business and College of Liberal Arts and Sciences. The university has been named a College of Distinction for 7 years running and has earned NASAD (MCD, architecture), AACSB (business), WSCUC, ACBSP (business), CIDA (architecture), and NAAB (architecture) accreditations. With an 8:1 student-to-faculty ratio, students learn from one of the most professionally accomplished faculties in the world, intern and work at the most innovative companies in the world, and go on to build careers that others only dream of. Please follow the link to learn more about Woodbury University: https://woodbury.edu/about/about-woodbury/facts-and-figures/ Apply on Institution's Website Related Searches: IT Manager/Director Want to learn more about working for this employer? title: Digital Comm Spec 3 (Multimedia Specialist)
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Digital Comm Spec 3 (Multimedia Specialist) University of California, Davis in Davis, CA Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: Multimedia Department Description Department Purpose Strategic Communications provides comprehensive and coordinated campus leadership in planning, creating and implementing integrated marketing and communications programs across all media that foster increased awareness, understanding and support of UC Davis' mission, vision, accomplishments and needs among its many internal and external constituencies. It serves as the official voice of UC Davis to regional, state, national and international news media. Strategic Communications encompasses six units: Visual Communications, News and Media Relations, Web Communications, Social Media, Marketing and Branding, and Executive Communications. Strategic Communications' multimedia storytellers, designers, Web developers, information architects and search-engine experts have a mission to communicate university messages through interactive media. We coordinate these communications across platforms to reach our audiences. Our efforts could be seen on the UC Davis home site, Discord, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok, YouTube and other sites and channels. Job Summary Under the direction of the Director of Visual Communications, coordinate and produce complex multimedia projects as assigned. Collaborate with members of Strategic Communications including the news team, social media team, web team and marketing team, as well as other key campus partners. Plan and write scripts, or execute scripts written by others. Develop project briefs and storyboards. Create videos for digital distribution, including incorporating still and motion graphics, and edit still photos for print and digital. Mentor staff in creating multimedia stories and advise on strategic usage of multimedia on digital platforms for effective integrated marketing and communications. Lead video trainings for other communicators on campus. Use the Visual Communication's video studio to produce content. Advise on equipment purchasing. Help manage the campus video archive. Keep current with video editing, photo editing and digital technologies and analytics tools. Serve as a backup photographer. Please note: There is a specific budget for this position Position Information Apply by Date August 10 th 2023 Salary Range $66,600/annually - $125,800/annually - Subject to a department specific budgeted amount. Appointment Type Career Number of Positions 1 Percentage of Time Full-Time, 100% Shift Hours Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm Location Davis, CA (This position may be eligible for remote and /or hybrid remote work arrangements) Union Representation No Benefits Eligible Yes PHYSICAL DEMANDS * Ability to see the full color spectrum of light and visually color-correct images with a high degree of accuracy. * Sit at computer for extended periods of time. * Lift objects up to 25 pounds, to include camera equipment, to various locations to conduct photographic shoots. WORK ENVIRONMENT UC Davis is a smoke and tobacco free campus effective January 1, 2014. Smoking, the use of smokeless tobacco products, and the use of unregulated nicotine products (e-cigarettes) will be strictly prohibited on any UC Davis owned or leased property, indoors and outdoors, including parking lots and residential space. https://ucdavispolicy.ellucid.com/documents/view/271 Work occasional weekends, evenings, and during news events. Regular travel on and occasionally beyond the UC Davis campus. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience Significant demonstrated experience as a visual storyteller with experience in documentary style production with responsibility of bringing projects from concept to completion, including writing, shooting and editing projects. Experience creating video in a studio setting, including the use of live switchers, multi camera storytelling, and green screen video production. Experience using lighting equipment to create a variety of looks in challenging locations. Experience using multiple audio tools for sound capture, including wireless lav mics, boom mics, on-camera mics. Demonstrated experience in training others in video, photography and related editing technologies. Expert level post production skills using Adobe Premiere and After Effects to create compelling, story-driven motion graphics. Time management skills. Skills to handle multiple projects under strict deadlines. Skills to maintain a positive connection with the university community, guests, visitors and the general public PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS * Experience writing scripts for short form documentary-style video productions, industrials, and promo videos, all from a journalism point-of-view. * Knowledge of the academic and research enterprises and skills in deciphering technical research information and findings, and in providing multimedia products that help communicate this information to the news media, campus community and University Communications' specific audiences. * Ability to work collaboratively with writers, editors, print and Web designers, and other key staff members to produce top quality content. * Ability to organize and maintain multimedia and photography materials online. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS Background Check This position is a critical position and subject to a background check. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of background investigation including criminal history and identity checks. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging At UC Davis, we're solving life's most urgent challenges to bring a fuller, healthier, and more resilient world within reach. We grow from every challenge we take on and we don't just maintain - we improve. We recognize that creating an inclusive and intellectually vibrant organization means understanding and valuing both our individual differences and our common ground. The most comprehensive solutions come from the most diverse minds, and you belong here. As you consider joining UC Davis, please explore our Principles of Community , our Clinical Strategic Plan and strategic vision for research and education, and our latest efforts to outgrow the expected . The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer advancing inclusive excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, protected veteran status, or other protected categories covered by the UC nondiscrimination policy. title: Media Support/Systems Specialist
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Media Support/Systems Specialist Salve Regina University in Newport, RI Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: Multimedia Company Description: Salve Regina University, ranked as one of the most transformative colleges in the United States by Money Magazine, is a comprehensive Catholic University located in the scenic coastal community of Newport, Rhode Island. The University's commitment to academic success and personal discovery extends beyond its historic campus into a dynamic world where the application of higher thinking and skill are most valued. Salve Regina offers bachelor's and master's degree programs, graduate certificates, and doctoral programs in humanities, international relations and nursing. Enrollment includes more than 2,600 undergraduate and graduate students from across the U.S. and around the world. Job Description: BASIC FUNCTION: The Media Support, Systems Specialist is responsible to the Media Services Manager for the supervision and operation of Media Services during the weekends, evenings and as needed. The Specialist supports media/audiovisual activities, and assists in the installation, functionality, maintenance, and upgrades of media systems. This includes classroom technology, auditoriums, video teleconferencing equipment and services, assistance and support in technology classroom throughout the University, including some flexible hours as needed. Some assistance with design, selection, repair, and installation of new and existing systems is required. Assistance with multimedia production and training for students, faculty and staff. The individual oversees work study attendance, and assists in completion of work study timesheets for approval by the Associate Director. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide support for the delivery, set-up, breakdown and retrieval of equipment related to events across campus. Maintaining inventory and equipment for next use in a neat and orderly fashion. Assist users with audiovisual, computer equipment, and related software. Supervise work study students. Notify appropriate staff through ticketing system of equipment failures. Testing, maintenance, and repair of all installed media systems hardware distributed throughout the campus, including, but not limited to, control systems, sound reinforcement systems, video projection, and remote access to devices. Adhere to the Service Level Agreements of the TSC and IT department. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and online meeting software including Zoom, WebEx, and Microsoft Teams, and their integration with cameras, microphones and other hardware. Make recommendations for new equipment and replacements in classrooms, labs, meeting rooms, auditoriums, theatres, and other areas as needed. Work closely with university members, the Media Systems Specialist, and the Director of Technical Services Center (TSC) to define needs and solutions to existing or new media systems installations. Maintain close communication with the TSC Director, Media Services Manager, other IT areas, other university departments and staff members on setup schedules and requests. Provide on-call support as requested by faculty, staff, and students. Facilitate repairs with external contractors as requested. Instruct faculty and students on the operation and usage of multimedia hardware and software, technology classroom hardware and software. Serve as first level of response to problems. Documentation of operational procedures and policies and contribute to documentation in other areas as needed. Instruct faculty and staff in use of video teleconferencing equipment, set-up equipment, media equipment, and create and maintain manuals for same. Knowledge of and access to inventory and warranty information of hardware. Setup, installation, repair, and frequency coordination of RF systems, including wireless mics, assistive listening, and RF control systems. Contact appropriate staff in cases of emergency outages related to power or network. Respond to level 1 and level 2 service requests and escalate as necessary OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Ability to monitor and maintain IT chat bot and respond to queries and update information in the bot and on the campus portal. Supervise and perform general and specific duties of lab operations, including opening and closing of Technology Services Center (TSC). Assist TSC technical support specialist in routine updates to hardware and software. Keep a ready supply of necessary minor equipment, cables, connectors, etc. to ensure ability to keep equipment functioning. Assist with video recording, and editing with knowledge of related software. Digitize video and storage of video using current software and within proper guidelines for classroom use. Assist with multimedia production projects. Keep informed of changes and advances in media systems, A/V technology, multimedia, and computer technology to better enhance the University's services in these areas. Provide exceptional customer service to members of the university community and guests. Participate in professional development. Share information gathered through R&D. Performs other duties as required by the Manager of Media Services. LICENSES, TOOLS, AND EQUIPMENT: Valid driver's license required. Cell phone. ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS: The incumbent is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions. Requirements: Required Qualifications: Associate's Degree required Understanding of the infrastructure standards and needs of audiovisual/media systems, broadcast systems, and RF systems. Strong oral and written communication skills required with the ability to serve a wide variety of people including students, staff, and faculty members. Must have strong organizational skills with attention to detail and accuracy. Required efficiency in Microsoft Office, media hardware control-related software, and multimedia hardware and software. Must be able to work independently as well as part of a team. Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. Position may be exposed to potentially loud noises; climbing ladders and using lifts required. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree or field experience preferred Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, schematics, and architectural blueprints a plus; skills in and use of AutoCAD software is a benefit. Knowledge of both PC and Mac computer, their multimedia capabilities, and knowledge of IP networks preferred. Additional Information: Salve Regina University offers generous benefits to eligible employees including (waiting periods apply): health, dental and vision coverage available on the first of the month following date of hire 403(b) retirement plan through TIAA with employee and employer contributions as well as access to advising services long-term disability coverage employer-paid life and AD&D insurance up to 100% free tuition at Salve for eligible employees and qualified dependents robust wellness program and free access to the on-campus Fitness Center Other available benefits include: supplemental life insurance for employees and dependents supplemental insurance coverage through Aflac Tuition Exchange scholarship program. Application available for qualified dependents of eligible employees working full-time discounted pet insurance through ASPCA student loan forgiveness assistance program (SAVI) discounted auto and home insurance through Liberty Mutual employee Assistance Program through Coastline EAP flexible spending health and dependent care accounts health savings accounts 529 collegebound saver program For more detailed information on Salve's benefits, visit https://salve.edu/human-resources/benefits . Salve Regina University strives to cultivate belonging values through diversity, equity inclusion in order to foster a welcoming culture for our staff, faculty and students, as well as the wider community. Salve Regina University embraces all people with grace. No matter the path traveled to get here, the University acknowledges that many identities will intersect. Salve Regina belongs to all in its community. Application Instructions: Applicants must apply online for any open staff and faculty positions by providing a cover-letter and resume. Pre-employment background checks and reference checks are required of successful candidates. Salve Regina University participates in E-verify. title: Mgr,Core IT Svcs (req26197)
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Mgr,Core IT Svcs (req26197) University of New Mexico in Albuquerque, NM Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/12/2023 Category: IT Manager/Director Requisition ID: req26197 Working Title: Mgr,Core IT Svcs Position Grade: 16 Position Summary UNM IT Academic Technologies seeks an experienced candidate with a desire to improve people's lives and change the world through support of educational technologies at a flagship research university. Focused on serving the needs of faculty and students across the state of New Mexico, UNM IT Academic Technologies supports teaching and learning tools in classrooms, computer labs, and online. Reporting to the Associate Director for UNM's IT Academic Technology / Learning Environments team, this position will serve as the lead technical manager for UNM's centrally scheduled classrooms and computer labs, and help set strategic directions in terms of access, technology, design, and policy. The Learning Environments team provides support for centrally scheduled computer labs and maker spaces, classroom computing and audiovisual technologies, support for student printing, and is involved in a wide range of capital projects across campus, from new buildings to classroom and meeting room renovations. This position will oversee multiple staff and student positions, and collaborate across the department, UNM IT, and the institution at large to deliver services. Specifically, this position will work closely with IT staff and students as well as the Scheduling Office, Academic Affairs, Planning Design, & Construction, faculty, and academic leadership in departments and colleges to ensure accessibility of effective and efficient technologies. The successful candidate will bring experience with higher education, computer lab management, classroom AV systems, enterprise printing, software licensing, customer support, data-driven decision making to help this team deliver enterprise services supporting the teaching, learning, and research missions of the university. Experience managing and supporting classroom and lab computing and AV systems is key to success in this position, including strong technical troubleshooting, communication, and documentation skills. Preferred candidates have experience in transforming student and instructor needs into technical solutions, and must be comfortable collecting and clarifying the requirements, leading group projects and trainings, creating proposals, achieving consensus on plans, and meeting production deadlines. Candidates must bring self-generated examples of documentation for systems or processes they have managed and be prepared to discuss their vision for technology as a component of educational innovation during the interview. This is a full-time position with benefits. See the Position Description for additional information. Conditions of Employment Successful candidate may be subject to a criminal background check prior to starting work. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree; at least 5 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified. Completed degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year basis. Preferred Qualifications Experience working at a higher education institution Experience managing computer labs and maker spaces, including space design, policy development, software requirements gathering and management Experience with supporting integrated classroom computing and A/V systems, including Crestron controls Experience managing staff and large numbers of student employees including hiring, training, work scheduling, and performance management Experience leading training and developing train-the-trainer strategies for student, faculty, and staff support Experience with enterprise print services for student printing Experience working with a diverse set of faculty, staff, and student stakeholders in a team environment Experience with GUI administration of Enterprise web applications Experience managing technical support queues in an incident/service ticketing system Experience managing employees Additional Requirements Applications need to include a complete professional work history with dates and hours worked. Campus: Main - Albuquerque, NM Department: IT Academic Technologies (321A) Employment Type: Staff Staff Type: Regular - Full-Time Status: Exempt Pay: Monthly: $6,548.53 to $9,373.87 DOE Benefits Eligible This is a benefits eligible position. The University of New Mexico provides a comprehensive package of benefits including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance. In addition, UNM offers educational benefits through the tuition remission and dependent education programs. See the Benefits home page for a more information. ERB Statement As a condition of employment, eligible employees working greater than .25 FTE as determined by the New Mexico Education Retirement Act must make mandatory retirement contributions. For more information, review the Benefits Eligibility at a Glance grid. Background Check Required: Yes For Best Consideration Date: 7/24/2023 Eligible for Remote Work No Application Instructions Only applications submitted through the official UNMJobs site will be accepted. If you are viewing this job advertisement on a 3rd party site, please visit UNMJobs to submit an application. Please include a Resume, Cover Letter, and writing sample (support document or knowledge base article written by the applicant if available; sample professional communication, if not). The University of New Mexico is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and Educator.
