title: Academic Multimedia Audio Visual Service Technician
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail Academic Multimedia Audio Visual Service Technician Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, NJ Apply on Institution's Website Type: Full-Time Posted: 07/13/2023 Category: Multimedia Job Number: RQ27006 Location: Hoboken, NJ - Main Campus Job Description Position Overview: The Academic Multimedia Audio Visual Service Technician is a full-time role reporting to the Associate Director of Academic Multimedia Services within the division of Information Technology at Stevens Institute of Technology. This on-site position requires a regular work schedule, with flexibility to work off hours and weekends as needed. The Service Technician is responsible for installing, maintaining, servicing, and supporting audio visual equipment and systems, supporting faculty, staff, and students in mediated spaces across campus with the primary focus being on classrooms technology. Key Responsibilities: Installation: Proficiently install, diagnose, and repair audiovisual cabling systems, control devices, audio digital signal processors (DSPs), speakers, microphones, cameras, displays, projectors, and projector screens. Ensure operational readiness of equipment before events and escalate logistical issues when necessary. Understand and interpret audiovisual system diagrams. Maintenance: Manage day-to-day housekeeping and maintenance of mediated spaces campus wide. Serve as a primary point of contact for classroom and event technology-related issues. Conduct routine in-person preventative maintenance testing and problem diagnosis for fully integrated AV/control systems. Provide monthly quality assurance status reports for all mediated spaces. Service: Coordinate service requests with external vendors. Collaborate with campus departments to schedule maintenance and testing of mediated spaces. Document equipment details, including checklists, design changes, and other required data. Develop and maintain documentation, including procedure manuals, troubleshooting guides, and policies to support clients' optimal use of University IT/AV resources and services. Maintain a consolidated asset inventory list of audiovisual hardware and peripherals. Provide first and second-tier technical support, document issues in the supported ticketing system, and provide solutions or escalate as needed. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree, with at least 5 years of experience in audiovisual technology or a related field; equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered. Intermediate to advanced skills in Windows-based and Mac-based platforms, including digital video signal processing and presentation. Proficiency in audiovisual technologies such as projection systems, audio systems, interactive displays, and design tools. Extensive experience in installing, diagnosing, and repairing audiovisual cabling systems and equipment. Proficiency in operating Windows and iOS systems, remote control systems (Crestron, AMX), and audio digital signal processing (DSP) programs. Familiarity with Crestron, web-based video conferencing platforms (Zoom, Teams), PTZ cameras (Logitech, Huddly, 1 Beyond, Vaddio, Poly), microphone systems (Shure), smartboards, and projection systems/displays (Epson, Samsung). Ability to comprehend audiovisual system diagrams. Strong commitment to learning and adapting to emerging technologies for teaching, learning, collaboration, and events. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong customer service skills and service ethic. Ability to lift between 30-50 pounds. Ability to handle multiple priorities in a dynamic environment with a sense of urgency. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in meeting support (in-person/hybrid). Active participation in professional organizations and relevant professional development programs. Audiovisual industry certifications preferred, such as InfoComm Avixa CTS, audio digital signal processing (DSP) certification (Biamp, QSC, etc.), and Crestron Technical Institute certification. Department Office of Client Support and Learning Technology Services General Submission Guidelines: In order to be considered a candidate for any job at Stevens, you must submit an online application. Please attach a cover letter and resume with each application. Other requirements for consideration may depend on the job. Still Have Questions? If you have any questions regarding your application, please contact Jobs@Stevens.edu EEO Statement: Stevens Institute of Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Accordingly, Stevens adheres to an employment policy that prohibits discriminatory practices or harassment against candidates or employees based on legally impermissible factor(s) including, but not necessarily limited to, race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, nationality, citizenship status, age, ancestry, marital or domestic partnership or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, atypical cellular or blood trait, genetic information, pregnancy or pregnancy-related medical conditions, disability, or any protected military or veteran status. Stevens is building a diverse faculty, staff and student body and strongly encourages applications from female and minority candidates as well as veterans and individuals with disabilities. Stevens is a federal contractor under the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) and the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as well as other federal statutes. Jeanne Clery Disclosure: In accordance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act), the Department of Public Safety is required to publish an annual security report which includes statistics mandated by the Clery Act. You can obtain a copy of this report by accessing the following web site: http://www.stevens.edu/sit/police Apply on Institution's Website Related Searches: Multimedia Want to learn more about working for this employer? title: CDA Program Liaison (Project Specialist IV) - College of Education and Human Development - R102127
description_text: Skip to main content Sign Up | Log In Job Search By Category Administrative Faculty Executive By Location Metro/Region State/Province Country Online/Remote By School Four-Year Institutions Two-Year Institutions All Institutions Institutional Profiles By Type Dual Career Today's Jobs Adjunct/Part-Time Diversity & Inclusion Military-Friendly Advanced Search My Account Account Home Job Agents Resume/CV Other Documents Organizer Account Information Sign In News & Resources News Advice & News Higher Ed Careers Author in Residence News Releases Newsletters HigherEdJobs Podcast Resources Career Resources Salary Data Job Search Tips Resume/CV Writing Service Diversity Resources Search Firms Employers Job Postings Post a Single Job Job Packs Unlimited Postings VIP Positions Automated Postings Other Products Employer Branding Resume Database Institutional Profile Interim Search View All Products Posting Upgrades Diversity & Inclusion Email Diversity & Inclusion Spotlight Priority Job Upgrade Military Upgrade Social Media Upgrade Featured Executive Position More Info Our Audience Testimonials Pay Your Invoice Contact Us Sign In Home Jobs Job Detail CDA Program Liaison (Project Specialist IV) - College of Education and Human Development - R102127 University of Louisville in Louisville, KY Apply on Institution's Website Type: Adjunct/Part-Time Posted: 07/13/2023 Category: Child Care Services Department: ECRC Location: Belknap Campus Time Type: Part time Worker Type: Regular Job Req ID: R102127 Minimum Requirements: Master's degree in Special Education, Education, or School Psychology and five years of related experience. Must have a Kentucky teaching certification or eligibility required. Board Certified Behavioral Analyst preferred. Additional experience may not be used on a one-to-one basis to offset the educational requirements. Position Description: This liaison will work with the OVEC grant project to instruct and support a Child Development Associate (CDA) program, which is scheduled for 30 hours per week. The CDA program requires 120 instructional hours in 8 subject areas. Additional support is required to support the completion of the CDA requirements, such as professional portfolio development, family questionnaires, and site visits to observe the CDA candidates as part of their final assessment. This position requires one-on-one support to counsel and advise prospective CDAs to complete the certification process in an efficient manner. This liaison will ensure updates to training materials/modules for proper learning and development. Recordkeeping is required for the CDA program. This position's duration will be 12 months and is contingent on grant funding. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Teaching CDA coursework Instructional design, learning, and development skills and abilities. Recordkeeping and documentation skills required to ensure three-year minimum documentation processes are maintained. Strong writing ability. Communication, such as advising or counseling, will be critical for student support. The ability to recognize conflict of interest by ensuring the structures provided by the University and OVEC are maintained. Preferred Qualifications Early Childhood Trainer's Credential, Level 5- This credential must be renewed every three years. Professional development specialist (PD Specialist) through the Council for Professional Recognition for Infant Toddlers and Preschool. This certification must be renewed every two years. Evidence of working with diverse learners Flexible schedule to meet the needs of the CDA candidates (e.g., some work on nights and weekends) Experience working with school staff Experience collaborating with school districts/ community partners Evidence of success incorporating technology into instructional practices Competencies Project Management - organized, task oriented, ability to delegate and follow up. Proactive - anticipates and plans for problems before they arise. Analytical- evaluating data and other information with the ability to choose the best solution and make recommendations. Flexible - ability to change directions as needed for the good of the department or organization. Service Excellence - responsive, informs constituents of process, pleasant to work with, educates and provides timely, accurate information. Organized - manages time effectively, keeps tasks appropriately prioritized. Critical Thinking - ability to think through issues and identify appropriate options. Work Ethic - motivated, diligent, industrious, and persistent in the workplace, stays on tasks to completion, works at a fast pace to ensure optimal efficiency. Interpersonal - can build effective, strong working relationships with employees, colleagues, management and vendors through trust, communication, and credibility. Teamwork - ability to work with others, serve others, help others, lead others, mentor others, take directions from others in the interest of moving process and programs forward to the desired outcome. Target Compensation Maximum: $85,798.00 Target Compensation Minimum: $48,421.00 Compensation will be commensurate to candidate experience. Equal Employment Opportunity The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status . If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258. Assistance and Accommodations Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208. If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.
